title.narrative: Third Colombian Dutch Dialogue on Transport

description.narrative: Two Dutch experts will participate in the third Colombian Dutch Dialogue on Transport and Logistics and will have bilateral meetings with several stakeholders from public, private and academic institutions. Main topics are urban logistics and port development/multimodal transport. This will help the Colombian government and private sector to further concretise their policies, also at the activities and project management level. Furthermore this project will help specify how Dutch knowledge and solutions can contribute to this.

title.narrative: Number of people directly reached - Local

comment.narrative: 100 high level representatives of public, private and academic sector have participated in the CDD III;

The third Dutch Colombian Dialogue (CDD) on Transport and Logistics was organized by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands between 24-27 september 2019 in the context of the official visit of tMayor Aboutaleb of Rotterdam to Colombia, together with the transport and logistics top sector. The CDD has positioned itself as a fruitful platform that contributes to connecting Dutch expertise and innovations with strategic developments in the local Colombian sectors of transport, logistics, and water, and its cross-overs themes related to the agricultural sector, urban planning and architecture and design (see strategic embedding for further information on the CDD).
Participants come from the government, from the academia, from important think-tanks and from private sector associations. Rotterdam was used as a case study in this CDD. Rotterdam is an inspiring case in the view of the local stakeholders, as an example of sustainable growth of a port city. This created an opportunity to showcase Dutch knowledge and solutions to make sure they stay top of mind in the design of public policies at a political level, and also at concrete working level.
Two Dutch experts participated as key note speakers and implemented a five day programme with local key public and academic institutions; and private organizations to identitfy the inpouts for a bilateral working agenda.: - Ron van Duin, PhD of the Delft University of Technology/Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences focused on urban logistics. - Onno Roelofs, from Stig B.V. focussed onport development and multimodal transport.
The CCD was implemented in cooperation with the Netherlands Enteprise Agency thorugh the Private Sector Development Program (PSD Toolkit) an Partners for Waters team (PVW) and in partnership with the Dutch Delta Cooperation Team, Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP) Partners in the host country were the following public and private organizations: the Ministry of Infrastructure of Colombia , the National Industrials Association of
